class.name: Rope
class.description: The class renders "rope" using verlet integration. It supports using nodes as rope ends, as well as attaching the rope to other objects in a scene.

method.name: _get_anchor_count
method.description:
Returns the number of anchors, excluding the fixed start and end anchor. Default implementation returns the number of anchors in the attached [class]RopeAnchorsBase[/class] object.
You can overload this to alter the number of anchors the rope will ask for in the related overloads.

method.name: _get_anchor_position
method.description: returns the position [0..1] of the anchor in the range [0.._get_anchor_count()-1].

method.name: _get_anchor_transform
method.description: returns the transform for the anchor in the range [0.._get_anchor_count()-1].

method.name: _get_attachment_count
method.description:
returns the number of attachments, excluding the start and end attachments. Default implementation returns the number of attachments in RopeAppearance.attachments if present.
You can overload this to alter the number of attachments the rope will ask for in related overloads.

method.name: _get_attachment_nodepath
method.description: returns the NodePath (relative to rope) for the attachment in the range [0.._get_attachment_count()-1]

method.name: _get_attachment_position
method.description: returns the rope position [0..1] for the attachment in the range [0.._get_attachment_count()-1]

method.name: _get_attachment_transform
method.description: returns the attachment transform for the attachment in the range [0.._get_attachment_count()-1]

method.name: get_all_links
method.description:
Returns a list of all the transforms for links used to render the rope.
The link transform is the orient transform midway between two particles. It is used to position the colliders and chain links if rendering.
There will be N-1 links per rope simulation particle.

method.name: get_all_rope_frames
method.description: Returns a list of all the transform frames used to render the rope. The frame tangents and normals are aligned along the rope and there will be more frames for higher LODs.

method.name: get_baked_mesh
method.description: Returns the current mesh of the rope. Changes every physics frame.

method.name: get_current_rope_length
method.description: returns the current length of the rope, which may be different than the specified length of the rope due to stretching.

method.name: get_link
method.description: Returns an individual link at index, or Transform.IDENTITY if out of bounds.

method.name: get_link_count
method.description: Returns the current number of links. Will be N-1 particles.

method.name: get_particle_count_for_length
method.description: returns the number of particles in the rope.

method.name: get_particle_positions
method.description: Returns the current positions for the rope particles. Particle positions are used to simulate the physics.

method.name: get_particles_per_meter
method.description: returns the number of particles per meter to generate for the rope. this will also impact the link and frame counts.

method.name: get_rope_frame
method.description: Returns an individual frame at index, or Transform.IDENTITY if out of bounds.

method.name: get_rope_frame_count
method.description: Returns the current number of frames.

method.name: get_rope_lod
method.description: returns the number of catmul spline points per rope simulation particle to generate along the rope.

method.name: get_rope_twist
method.description: returns the V coordinate multiplier for texture UV coordinates.

members.member: A RopeAnchorsBase resource containing additional anchors to attach the rope to. All anchors will be aligned to the nearest frame, and so the positions are dependent on the number of particles in the rope and the LOD.
A RopeAppearance resource containing properties that control how the rope is rendered.
NodePath to a node to anchor the end of the rope to. The end of the rope will follow this node.
At 0.0 the rope will slide off surfaces. At 1.0 the rope will stick to surfaces.
Gravity vector to apply to the rope simulation. Default is (0, -9.8, 0).
Virtual time to calculate into the future before first render. This will run [code]preprocess_time * simulation_rate[/code] frames as fast as possible.
Length of the rope. Segments will be `rope_length / rope_particles` long.
Framerate to run the simulation at in FPS.
NodePath to a node to anchor the start of the rope to. The origin of the rope will follow this node. Can point to self.

Stiffness factor. Controls stretchyness of rope. Should be around [0.8 - 1.2] for a realistic rope. Higher values may lead to instability in the simulation. Increasing stiffness_iterations may restabilize.
When performing stiffness calculations, the number of passes through the rope to run per frame. Higher values will improve stiffness stability.
Scale factor to apply to the wind vector when applying it to the rope simulation.
